data: {"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3410881,"name":"Sam","username":"Paraduks","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/p/ea5d25/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-07-24T17:16:27.839Z","cooked":"\u003cp\u003eI recently came across \u003ca href=\"https://pythontutor.com/\" rel=\"noopener nofollow ugc\"\u003ehttps://pythontutor.com/\u003c/a\u003e and I was blown away by how it visualizes your code, making simple, whiteboard-like diagrams of the current state of your program.  It’s one of the few tools I’ve seen that clearly lays out what’s in the stack, what’s in the heap, and where references point to.  You can step through each line of your code and see variables being initialized, memory being allocated and freed, references being made, and stack frames being entered and exited.  I wanted to share this resource because it’s a great way to teach new coders—I know I will use it the next time someone asks me about a null pointer dereference!  \u003ca href=\"https://pythontutor.com/visualize.html#code=//%20Demo%20of%20null%20pointer%20dereference%0A%0A%23include%20%3Ciostream%3E%0A%0Aint%20main%28%29%0A%7B%0A%20%20//%20first,%20we%20make%20a%20space%20in%20the%20heap%20big%20enough%20for%20one%20integer,%20and%20reference%20it%0A%20%20int*%20ref%20%3D%20%28int*%29%20malloc%28sizeof%28int%29%29%3B%0A%20%20%0A%20%20//%20then,%20we%20put%20a%20number%20in%20that%20space%0A%20%20*ref%20%3D%2024%3B%0A%20%20%0A%20%20//%20somehow,%20that%20space%20on%20the%20heap%20gets%20cleared%0A%20%20free%28ref%29%3B%0A%20%20%0A%20%20//%20but%20we%20think%20it's%20still%20there,%20so%20we%20try%20to%20access%20it%0A%20%20int%20foo%20%3D%20*ref%3B%0A%20%20%0A%20%20//%20The%20program%20crashes!%20%20The%20reference%20doesn't%20point%20to%20anything%20anymore%0A%20%20%0A%20%20%0A%20%20//%20If%20you%20understand%20this,%20you%20know%20more%20than%20Crowdstrike!%0A%20%20%0A%20%20return%200%3B%0A%7D\u0026amp;cumulative=false\u0026amp;heapPrimitives=nevernest\u0026amp;mode=edit\u0026amp;origin=opt-frontend.js\u0026amp;py=cpp_g%2B%2B9.3.0\u0026amp;rawInputLstJSON=%5B%5D\u0026amp;textReferences=false\"
